syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: find the equation of a straight line given sufficient information
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. given two points, or one point and the gradient.

learning_objectives.description: interpret and use any of the forms y = mx + c, y - y₁ = m(x - x₁), ax + by + c = 0 in solving problems
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including calculations of distances, gradients, midpoints, points of intersection and use of the relationship between the gradients of parallel and perpendicular lines.

learning_objectives.description: understand that the equation (x – a)² + (y - b)² = r² represents the circle with centre (a, b) and radius r
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including use of the expanded form x² + y² + 2gx + 2fy + c = 0.

learning_objectives.description: use algebraic methods to solve problems involving lines and circles
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including use of elementary geometrical properties of circles, e.g. tangent perpendicular to radius, angle in a semicircle, symmetry. Implicit differentiation is not included.

learning_objectives.description: understand the relationship between a graph and its associated algebraic equation, and use the relationship between points of intersection of graphs and solutions of equations.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. to determine the set of values of k for which the line y = x + k intersects, touches or does not meet a quadratic curve.
